key_insight: StreamAvatar adapts diffusion-based avatar generation to a causal, low-latency streaming setting using a two-stage pipeline, enabling real-time, interactive full-body avatars instead of only head-and-shoulder illusions.
problem_solved: Bridges the gap between high-quality diffusion avatar models and real-time interactive use by removing non-causal components and reducing computational cost so avatars can stream continuous gestures and body motion with low latency.
method: Two-stage streaming pipeline: a fast coarse stage that predicts temporally-consistent pose/structure and a refinement stage that generates high-fidelity appearance conditioned on the streamed state.
Causal/streaming diffusion design: convert non-causal diffusion sampling into an online, frame-by-frame process with temporal conditioning and state caching to avoid reprocessing history.
Efficiency optimizations for low latency: lightweight decoders, progressive refinement, and scheduling strategies that prioritize immediate frames while refining past frames asynchronously.
impact: Enables deployable, real-time interactive digital humans for VR/AR, telepresence, live streaming, and games by making diffusion-quality avatars practical under tight latency and compute budgets.
